channel.title: Need Help please take a look
channel.description:
ok i have done everything portforward.com has told me to do now my isp is clear wireless and they allow portforwarding so i know i a doing something wrong please someone (who is actualy experienced and knows what they are doing) help me...
[IMG]http://i1239.photobucket.com/albums/ff502/codyskate5021/helpme.jpg[/img]

item.title: Need Help please take a look
item.dc:creator: @codyskate5021 codyskate5021

@codyskate5021 wrote:

kk

item.title: Need Help please take a look
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“blitz_9100, post:12, topic:421524”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=524188.msg3814824#msg3814824 date=1321228229]

It doesn’t look like your running your server when you test it. The server needs to be running so the test can try to connect to it.

Lol… No.
It’s a generic test; why would it specifically require a runescape private server to be online? facepalm
It only requires that the port is opened.

A server needs to be listening for connections so the tool can connect and check if the port is correctly forwarded. Its not specifically designed for rsps nor did I say it was.

So what is this server you are speaking of?
It’s running locally. There’s no server to test.
[/quote]
The router has been told where to forward the connection on that port, but since nothing listening on that port the connection test is failing.[/quote]
The program is listening… How else would it know if it was receiving the connection?[quote=“codyskate5021, post:13, topic:421524”]i ran my server and i still did not connect maybe eyeownyew can you try and set me up ? please[/quote]
Sorry not big on portforwarding.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help please take a look

It doesn’t look like your running your server when you test it. The server needs to be running so the test can try to connect to it.

Lol… No.
It’s a generic test; why would it specifically require a runescape private server to be online? facepalm
It only requires that the port is opened.

A server needs to be listening for connections so the tool can connect and check if the port is correctly forwarded. Its not specifically designed for rsps nor did I say it was.

So what is this server you are speaking of?
It’s running locally. There’s no server to test.
[/quote]
The router has been told where to forward the connection on that port, but since nothing listening on that port the connection test is failing.[/quote]
i ran my server and i still did not connect maybe eyeownyew can you try and set me up ? please

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help please take a look
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:11, topic:421524”][quote author=blitz_9100 link=topic=524188.msg3814820#msg3814820 date=1321227942]

It doesn’t look like your running your server when you test it. The server needs to be running so the test can try to connect to it.

Lol… No.
It’s a generic test; why would it specifically require a runescape private server to be online? facepalm
It only requires that the port is opened.

A server needs to be listening for connections so the tool can connect and check if the port is correctly forwarded. Its not specifically designed for rsps nor did I say it was.
[/quote]
So what is this server you are speaking of?
It’s running locally. There’s no server to test.[/quote]
The router has been told where to forward the connection on that port, but since nothing listening on that port the connection test is failing.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help please take a look
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Let me explain it a little more clear. You need to tell the router where to send the connection.Right now the router doesn’t know where to send it. Here is a better way to describe, The black box is opening a command prompt and typing in ipconfig.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help please take a look

item.title: Need Help please take a look
item.dc:creator: @codyskate5021 codyskate5021
item.description:
@codyskate5021 wrote:

blitz_9100:

The IP Address input needs to reflect the one when you use IPConfig. IE: 192.168.1.131 would be mine, So I would put 131 in the box. You can also find it by going to Status-> Local network - DHCP Table, Then looking for the name of your computer.

i did all of that i have clear wireless and i called them confirming we are allowed to portforward… i do have the ability

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help please take a look

item.description:
@system wrote:

The IP Address input needs to reflect the one when you use IPConfig. IE: 192.168.1.131 would be mine, So I would put 131 in the box. You can also find it by going to Status-> Local network - DHCP Table, Then looking for the name of your computer.

item.title: Need Help please take a look
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

Go to your firewall, then go to exceptions
Click add a port, obviously enter 43594 and the name being RSPS make it TCP
then do the same thing but make it UDP.

Also you need a static IP -from what i understand, i never put my servers online ^.^-

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help please take a look

try setting the protocol to “TCP” or what ever it is. It might do something.
